Jan 22, 2024

1. Minutes of the City Council - Regular Meeting -December 18, 2023 5:30 PM

RESULT:
ACCEPTED [6-0-3-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Toner, Mayor Simmons

PRESENT:
Councillor Pickett, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Wilson,

2. Minutes of the City Council - Inaugural Meeting -January 1, 2024 10:00 AM

RESULT:
ACCEPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Toner, Mayor Simmons Councillor Pickett, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler,
Councillor Wilson

3. Minutes of the City Council - Regular Meeting -January 8, 2024 5:30 PM

RESULT:
ACCEPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Toner, Mayor Simmons Councillor Pickett, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler,
Councillor Wilson


PAGE 2

Jan 22, 2024

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appointment of
Jessica Eshleman as a new member of the Cambridge Health Alliance Board of Trustees for a term
ending on 6/30/2026, and would be eligible for reappointment for an additional three (3) three-year
term.
CMA 2024 #5
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons

2. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the Massachusetts
Avenue Planning Study Working Group -- Cambridge Common to Alewife Brook Parkway.
CMA 2024 #6
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons

3. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to an update on the
MBTA's upcoming Red Line track improvement project.
CMA 2024 #7
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons


PAGE 3

Jan 22, 2024

II. CALENDAR

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
1. ORDD-2023-8B : Ordinance 2023 #8B Amend Chapter 14.04 – Fair Housing
ORDD-2023-8B
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 2, 2023.
FURTHER AMENDED IN COUNCIL NOVEMBER 6, 2023.
THIS ITEM WILL REMAIN ON UNFINISHED BUSINESS UNTIL THE STATE
LEGISLATURE APPROVES THE SPECIAL ACT THAT IS NEEDED BEFORE THIS
CAN BE ORDAINED
ORDD-2023-8B
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 4

Next: 1/29/2024 5:30 PM

Jan 22, 2024

III. COMMUNICATIONS

manufacturers from doing business in Cambridge.

RESULT:

RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:

Wilson, Mayor Simmons

RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons

Wilson, Mayor Simmons

PAGE 13

Jan 22, 2024

V. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Council schedule a Roundtable for February 5, 2024.
POR 2024 #3
Mayor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons

2. That the City Manager is requested to direct the relevant City staff to evaluate the possibility of
acquiring the property located at 727 Massachusetts Avenue.
POR 2024 #4
Mayor Simmons, Vice Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons

3. That the City Manager is hereby requested to confer with relevant City departments on potential
public renewable energy projects that could receive funding through the IRA Direct Pay provision.
POR 2024 #5
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Wilson
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons

4. That the City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments with recommendations
and legal opinions for adjusting transportation related fees and other considered changes.
POR 2024 #6
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Azeem
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons


PAGE 14

Jan 22, 2024

5. That the City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to review the Across
Sidewalk Electric Vehicle Charging (EV) Permit Pilot Program, eliminate the $200 annual permit fee
and determine if the process can be simplified. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY MAYOR
SIMMONS IN COUNCIL JANUARY 22, 2024
POR 2024 #7
Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT

Next: 1/29/2024 5:30 PM

6. Policy Order re Joint Roundtable on February 5
POR 2024 #8
Mayor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons

Dec 18, 2023

Packet Pg. 18

1

MINUTES OF THE
CAMBRIDGE CITY COUNCIL REGULAR MEETING
Monday, December 18, 2023

The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui called the meeting to order and asked the Clerk to call the roll.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Present/In Person
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Present/In Person
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Present/In Person
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Present/In Person
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Present/In Person
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Present/Remote
Councillor Paul Toner – Present/In Person
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Present/In Person
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Present/In Person
Present-9. Quorum established.
PUBLIC COMMENT
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized individuals for public comment. The following
individuals participated and were allowed up to 2 minutes to speak:
Tara Gohlmann, 80 Gerry’s Landing Road, Cambridge, MA, asked the Council to vote against
CMA 2023 #303.
Jen Price, 80 Gerry’s Landing Road, Cambridge, MA, urged the Council to vote against CMA
2023 #303.
Deb Ashman, 22 Linnaean Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments that were in support of the
proposed BEUDO amendment.
August Watson. 795 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge, MA, spoke in strong support of Policy
Order 2023 #215.
Hannah Mahoney, 7 Rindge Terrace, Cambridge, MA, offered comments that were in favor of
proposed amendments to BEUDO.
Louise Venden, 10 Rogers Street, Cambridge, MA, shared they were in support of POR 2023
#215.
Lea Kayali, Porter Square, shared they were in support of POR 2023 #215.
Elena Fagotto, 26 Bigelow Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments that were in favor of
BEUDO.
Megan Lim, 449 Broadway, Cambridge, MA, offered comments that were not in support of
Cambridge Police.

1
Packet Pg. 19

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Dec 18, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

A Regular Meeting of the Cambridge City Council was held on Monday, December 18, 2023.
The meeting was called to order at 5:30 p.m. by the Honorable Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui. Pursuant
to Chapter 2 of the Acts of 2023, adopted by Massachusetts General Assembly and approved by
the Governor, this public meeting was hybrid allowing participation in person and via Zoom.

Judy Somberg, 48 Antrim Street, Cambridge, MA, urged the Council to pass proposed
amendments to BEUDO.
Leila Skinner, 37 Lee Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments that were in support of POR
2023 #215.
Evan MacKay, 64 Linnaean Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments that were in favor of the
proposed BEUDO amendments.
Steven Miller, 92 Miller Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of the revised amendments to
BEUDO.
Mosammat A, Inman Square, offered comments that were in favor of POR 2023 #215.
Maya A, Central Square Library, offered comments in support of POR 2023 #215.
Timothy Bilodeau, 40 Cushing Street, Cambridge, MA, shared their strong support for POR 2023
#215.
Marilyn Frankenstein, West Cambridge, offered comments on Cambridge Police and POR 2023
#215.
Fatema Ahmad, 130 Bishop Allen Drive, Cambridge, MA, offered comments in support of POR
2023 #215.
Lida Richardson, 40 Highland Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments that were in favor of
POR 2023 #215.
Kavya Crasta, Riverside, offered comments that were in support of POR 2023 #215.
Aicha Belabbes, 25 8th Street, Cambridge, MA, shared they support POR 2023 #215.
Bob Mallon, 3 Maple Avenue, Cambridge, MA, offered comments in support of Resolution #6.
Jay Baronowski, 155 Federal Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in support of BEUDO amendments.
Charles Franklin, 162 Hampshire Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments that were in support
of proposed BEUDO amendments.
Cynthia Hibbard, 23 Ellsworth Avenue, Cambridge, MA, offered comments that were in favor of
BEUDO.
Fawaz Abusharkh, 4 Harrison Road, spoke in support of POR 2023 #215.
Arpita Joyce, spoke in support of POR 2023 #215.
Daphne Argueso, 26 Bigelow Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of BEUDO.
Beth Maloney, Kendall Square Business Association, offered comments that were not in favor of
proposed amendments to BEUDO.
Rachel Bickelman offered their full support for proposed BEUDO amendments and POR 2023
#215.
Lee Farris, 260 Norfolk Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in strong support to proposed amendments
to BEUDO and POR 2023 #215.
Leah Brill, Cambridge Public Library, spoke in support of POR 2023 #215.
Lucy Tumavicus, 449 Broadway, Somerville, MA, offered comments in favor of POR 2023 #215.
Payel Islam, 1493 Cambridge Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in support of POR 2023 #215.
Isabelle Woollacott, Cambridge Hospital, spoke in support of POR 2023 #215.
Corinne Espinoza, Central Square, spoke in support of POR 2023 #215.
James Williamson, Churchill Avenue, Cambridge, MA, offered comments in favor of POR 2023
#215.
Roy Russell, 40 Cottage Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments on CMA 2023 #307.

The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to close public comment.

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Dec 18, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

1

The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Simmons who made a motion to suspend
the rules to bring forward the Resolution on the death of Paul Parravano, RES 2023 #306.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Absent
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-8, Absent-1. Motion passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Simmons who spoke on the life and
contributions of Paul Parravano noting that Paul epitomized grace. The Chair, Mayor
Siddiqui the recognized Councillor McGovern, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Toner,
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, and Councillor Zondervan, who spoke about what a
special person Paul was. The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui also offered her condolences to the family
and noted what a huge loss this is for the community.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to amend the resolution to add the entire
Council as cosponsors.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Absent
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-8, Absent-1. Motion passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Simmons who made a motion to adopt
RES 2023 #306 as amended.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.

Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes

Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-8, Absent-1. Motion passed.

1

The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to adopt the balance of the CMAs/orders to
approve appointments and reappointments, and appropriation orders: CMA 2023 #304,
CMA 2023 #305, and CMA 2023 #308 and place the CMAs on file.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Absent
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-8, Absent-1. Motion passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Simmons who spoke on CMA 2023 #299
relative to the 20th anniversary of same-sex marriage in the Commonwealth of
Massachusetts. The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui also recognized Councillor Nolan and City Manager
Huang who spoke on the topic.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Simmons who made a motion to place
CMA 2023 #299 on file.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Absent
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-8, Absent-1. Motion passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui spoke on CMA 2023 #300 relative to updating the City’s
Parental Leave Policy, noting that she was happy to see the update and grateful for the
change that makes the City a better employer. The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui also recognized
Councillor McGovern who asked if it applied to School employees and if there was
consideration being given to a similar policy to allow staff to care for sick family members. The
City’s Chief People Officer Rae Catchings noted that this currently covers non-union employees
and does not address caring for family members.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to place CMA 2023 #300 on file.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.

responds to situations that could lead to violence and death. The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui also

Simmons, Councillor Toner and Councillor Carlone for comments and questions. The Chair,
Mayor Siddiqui also offered comments. Throughout the discussion, the Chair, Mayor Siddiqui
recognized City Manager Huang and Commissioner Elow who provided an update and
responded to Councillors and addressed comments made during public comment.

Packet Pg. 30

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Dec 18, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

RESOLUTIONS

1

The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Nolan who spoke on RES 2023 #308
congratulating Moungi Bawendi on receiving the 2023 Nobel Prize in Chemistry “for the
discovery and synthesis of quantum dots” along with Louis Brus and Alexei Ekimov.
Councillor Nolan made a motion to adopt the order for RES 2023 #308.
Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Absent
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-8, Absent-1. Motion passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to take up RES 2023 #311 thanking Alanna
Mallon, RES 2023 #312 thanking Quinton Zondervan and RES 2023 #313 thanking Dennis
Carlone, together.
Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Absent
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-8, Absent-1. Motion passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Nolan, Councillor Azeem, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Toner, Councillor Simmons, City Manager Huang, Deputy City
Manager O’Riordan, Assistant City Manager Farooq, Matt Nelson, Special Assistant to the
City Council Naomie Stephan, and City Clerk LeBlanc who each offered words of thanks,
praise, reflection and well wishes to Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Zondervan and
Councillor Carlone. The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui also offered her gratitude and reflections.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to adopt RES 2023 #311 thanking Alanna
Mallon for her service to the citizens of Cambridge, and RES 2023 #312 thanking Quinton
Zondervan for his service to the citizens of Cambridge, and RES 2023 #313 thanking
Dennis Carlone for his service to the citizens of Cambridge.
Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
13
Packet Pg. 31

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Dec 18, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-8, Absent-1. Motion passed.

Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-9. Motion passed.
POLICY ORDERS
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Simmons who made a motion to adopt
POR 2023 #218 relative to a suitable memorial in Cambridge in honor of Paul Parravano.
Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-9. Motion passed.
